tracks.name: Yas Marina Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Yas Marina Circuit, which has served as a dazzling conclusion to recent Formula1 seasons, is known for its epic twilight race. The track features tight corners and long straights, and it includes the backdrop of the Yas Hotel. It's served as the final stretch for drivers and constructors aching to etch out a few more points in the championship standings,

tracks.name: Las Vegas Strip Street Circuit
tracks.blurb: This track welcomes the glitz and glamour of the entertainment capital, the Las Vegas Street Circuit offers a thrilling urban racing experience against the backdrop of the city's iconic landmarks. This newly introduced track is characterized by long, fast straights that wind through the bustling streets, providing adrenaline-pumping moments for drivers and fans alike.

tracks.name: Circuit of the Americas
tracks.blurb: This modern track in the heart of Texas boasts huge elevation changes, multiple challenging turns, and a thrilling atmosphere. Hundreds of thousands of fans from across the country flock to the Circuit of the Americas for a weekend full of racing, music and Texan pride.

tracks.name: Losail International Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Losail International Circuit, conceived in a whirlwind to accommodate Qatar's inaugural MotoGP in 2004, was born to host high-speed thrills. It has since evolved to embrace the pinnacle of motorsport, welcoming its maiden Formula 1 Grand Prix in 2021.

tracks.name: Suzuka International Racing Course
tracks.blurb: A figure-eight track with challenging corners like the 'S' Curves and the famous 130R, known for its demanding yet rewarding layout.

tracks.name: Marina Bay Street Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Marina Bay Street Circuit is a captivating fusion of speed and spectacle. Illuminated by a stunning array of lights against the backdrop of Singapore's skyline, this challenging track winds through the heart of the city.

tracks.name: Circuit Park Zandvoort
tracks.blurb: Spanning approximately 4.3 kilometers, Zandvoort features a mix of fast, sweeping sections and tight, technical corners. The track begins with the high-speed Tarzanbocht, a sharp hairpin turn that often sets the stage for overtaking maneuvers at the end of the main straight.

tracks.name: Circuit de Spa-Francorchamps
tracks.blurb: Spa-Francorchamps is a legendary track that winds through the picturesque Ardennes forest. Its undulating layout combines high-speed straights like the famed Eau Rouge-Raidillon complex with challenging corners such as Pouhon and Blanchimont, testing the mettle and bravery of drivers.

tracks.name: Hungaroring
tracks.blurb: The Hungaroring is a twisty, technical track with limited overtaking chances, testing driver skills on tight corners and short straights.

tracks.name: Silverstone Circuit
tracks.blurb: It's one of the oldest F1 circuits, and it's iconic. A high-speed track with fast corners like Copse and Maggots-Becketts-Chapel complex.

tracks.name: Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya
tracks.blurb: The Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya is a revered track in F1 that offers a diverse range of corners, testing the balance between high-speed sections and technical turns.

tracks.name: Circuit de Monaco
tracks.blurb: The Circuit de Monaco is iconic. The epitome of prestige, featuring narrow streets, tight corners, hairpin turns and limited overtaking opportunities. It demands skill and precision, and all it takes is a bit of rain to make it one of the most interesting tracks of the season. At this track, qualifying is key.

tracks.name: Miami International Autodrome
tracks.blurb: The Miami Autodrome made a thrilling addition to the Formula 1 roster recently, and it is a testament to the sport's growing American audience. This track, set in the vibrant city of Miami, Florida, embraces a blend of high-speed straights and technical corners designed to challenge the world's finest drivers.

tracks.name: Baku City Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Baky city circuit in Azerbaijan is renowned for its long straight and tight, narrow sections through the city streets, making it a high-speed challenge.

tracks.name: Albert Park Grand Prix Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Albert Park Circuit, nestled in the heart of Melbourne, kicks off the Formula 1 season with its fast and flowing layout around Albert Park Lake. This temporary street circuit combines a mix of fast straights and challenging corners, including the high-speed sections around Turns 11 and 12, demanding precision and agility from drivers.

tracks.name: Jeddah Corniche Circuit
tracks.blurb: Carved along the Red Sea coastline, this adrenaline-fueled track marks Saudi Arabia's entry into the world of motorsport, captivating enthusiasts with its mesmerizing 6.175-kilometer layout, winding through the city's urban landscape.

tracks.name: Bahrain International Circuit
tracks.blurb: The Bahrain International Circuit, a marvel of a track, offers a unique blend of technical challenges and fast-paced racing. The track's layout features a mix of long straights, demanding hairpin turns, and tricky sections.

track_info.blurb: The Circuit de Monaco is iconic. The epitome of prestige, featuring narrow streets, tight corners, hairpin turns and limited overtaking opportunities. It demands skill and precision, and all it takes is a bit of rain to make it one of the most interesting tracks of the season. At this track, qualifying is key.

The Albert Park Circuit, nestled in the heart of Melbourne, kicks off the Formula 1 season with its fast and flowing layout around Albert Park Lake. This temporary street circuit combines a mix of fast straights and challenging corners, including the high-speed sections around Turns 11 and 12, demanding precision and agility from drivers.

This track welcomes the glitz and glamour of the entertainment capital, the Las Vegas Street Circuit offers a thrilling urban racing experience against the backdrop of the city's iconic landmarks. This newly introduced track is characterized by long, fast straights that wind through the bustling streets, providing adrenaline-pumping moments for drivers and fans alike.

This modern track in the heart of Texas boasts huge elevation changes, multiple challenging turns, and a thrilling atmosphere. Hundreds of thousands of fans from across the country flock to the Circuit of the Americas for a weekend full of racing, music and Texan pride.

The Bahrain International Circuit, a marvel of a track, offers a unique blend of technical challenges and fast-paced racing. The track's layout features a mix of long straights, demanding hairpin turns, and tricky sections.

The Marina Bay Street Circuit is a captivating fusion of speed and spectacle. Illuminated by a stunning array of lights against the backdrop of Singapore's skyline, this challenging track winds through the heart of the city.

The Miami Autodrome made a thrilling addition to the Formula 1 roster recently, and it is a testament to the sport's growing American audience. This track, set in the vibrant city of Miami, Florida, embraces a blend of high-speed straights and technical corners designed to challenge the world's finest drivers.

The Losail International Circuit, conceived in a whirlwind to accommodate Qatar's inaugural MotoGP in 2004, was born to host high-speed thrills. It has since evolved to embrace the pinnacle of motorsport, welcoming its maiden Formula 1 Grand Prix in 2021.

Carved along the Red Sea coastline, this adrenaline-fueled track marks Saudi Arabia's entry into the world of motorsport, captivating enthusiasts with its mesmerizing 6.175-kilometer layout, winding through the city's urban landscape.
The Baky city circuit in Azerbaijan is renowned for its long straight and tight, narrow sections through the city streets, making it a high-speed challenge.
The Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya is a revered track in F1 that offers a diverse range of corners, testing the balance between high-speed sections and technical turns.
A figure-eight track with challenging corners like the 'S' Curves and the famous 130R, known for its demanding yet rewarding layout.
The Hungaroring is a twisty, technical track with limited overtaking chances, testing driver skills on tight corners and short straights.

The Circuit Gilles Villeneuve in Montreal, Canada, is an exhilarating track renowned for its demanding yet thrilling layout, with its iconic hairpin turn. Its combination of fast straights and tight corners puts drivers to the test and pushes their cars to the limits.

São Paulo's Interlagos Circuit stands as a thrilling F1 track in Brazil. Its layout presents a captivating blend of high-speed straights and demanding corners. The Senna 'S' curves challenge drivers at the start, demanding precision and finesse.

The "Red Bull Ring" in is a picturesque and compact circuit that offers a unique racing experience. The track is nestled amidst the stunning Styrian mountains, and boasts a relatively short layout with rapid elevation changes and challenging corners.

At just over 4.3 kilometers in length, this circuit is situated at high altitude, which affects both the cars' performance and the drivers' physical capabilities. The track features a long main straight, allowing for blistering speeds as cars approach the challenging first corner, the famous Peraltada.

Spanning approximately 4.3 kilometers, Zandvoort features a mix of fast, sweeping sections and tight, technical corners. The track begins with the high-speed Tarzanbocht, a sharp hairpin turn that often sets the stage for overtaking maneuvers at the end of the main straight.

Monza, the 'Temple of Speed', is an iconic and legendary track located near Milan, Italy. It stands as one of the oldest and most revered circuits in the world of motorsport. Spanning around 5.8 kilometers, Monza is renowned for its blistering straights and historic significance.

Spa-Francorchamps is a legendary track that winds through the picturesque Ardennes forest. Its undulating layout combines high-speed straights like the famed Eau Rouge-Raidillon complex with challenging corners such as Pouhon and Blanchimont, testing the mettle and bravery of drivers.
It's one of the oldest F1 circuits, and it's iconic. A high-speed track with fast corners like Copse and Maggots-Becketts-Chapel complex.

The Yas Marina Circuit, which has served as a dazzling conclusion to recent Formula1 seasons, is known for its epic twilight race. The track features tight corners and long straights, and it includes the backdrop of the Yas Hotel. It's served as the final stretch for drivers and constructors aching to etch out a few more points in the championship standings,
